0.title: Research, Pedagogy, and Discovery Seminar
0.content: UC Berkeley and Tuskegee University . This Summer 2022 Program presents an introductory data science curriculum that integrates research, pedgagogy, and discovery. There are two parts: . | A 2-week â€œCoding Bootcampâ€ that teaches computing topics (without the data) and precedes an introductory data science course such as Data 6. Uses material from CS 61A, Data 6, and Data 8. Available at bootcamp. | An 8-week Research, Pedagogy, and Discovery Seminar. Available from the top page. | .

2.title: Announcements
2.content: Announcements are stored in the _announcements directory and rendered according to the layout file, _layouts/announcement.html.

3.title: Welcome~
3.content: Jun 13 · 0 min read Welcome! This website will serve as a resource for you as you move through this summer program. We recommend bookmarking this website for easy access. Please see the sidebar for the pre-Data 6 Coding Bootcamp link. Additionally, please make sure you have access to the following course resources: . | Schedule | RPD Slack | DataHub | . If you donâ€™t have access to any of the above websites, please email yanlisa@eecs.berkeley.edu. See you soon!Lisa .

19.title: Python Documentation
19.content: Learning a new programming language like Python is a lot like learning a new language: you have to learn vocabulary and learn how to string words together to make sentences that are gramatically and syntactically correct. Just like you might use a dictionary to learn the meaning of new words, programmers use documentation to understand what functions and data types do and how they operate. Here are documentation sources that are helpful for understanding the functions and objects we use in Data 6: . | Data 6 Python Reference Guide . | This has documentation for all of the functions we expect you to know in Data 6. You can use this as your â€œcheat sheetâ€ while working on assignments. We will also provide a shortened version of the reference guide for the final exam. | . | Data 8 Python Reference | [Official Python Documentation] | [datascience Library Documentation] | .

20.title: Supplemental Readings
20.content: Although there is no specific textbook for this class, we will draw on concepts from a couple of textbooks from similar data science and computer science classes. For most lectures, we will post links to chapters from textbooks covering the topics we will discuss in lecture. These supplemental readings are optional, but you might find it helpful . We do not expect you to read these textbooks in their entirety (in fact, most of their material is out of scope for this class).

34.title: Staff
34.content: Read more about our amazing Data 6 course staff below! Weâ€™re all current or recent Berkeley undergraduates, so feel free to reach out with any questions about life at UC Berkeley, the data science major, or anything else Cal related! .
